div.p: Guidance on interpreting the table can be found here.

span.title:
Sponsor's study ID
Sponsor's study ID

Sponsor's study ID
Sponsor's study ID

tr.td:
Mapping is based on presumption that research subject will be tied to site-specific ResearchStudy, which will then be part of overall ResearchStudy.
Mapping is based on presumption that research subject will be tied to site-specific ResearchStudy, which will then be part of overall ResearchStudy.

span.title:
Sponsor's site ID
Sponsor's site ID
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td:
Mapping is based on presumption that research subject will be tied to site-specific ResearchStudy, which will then be part of overall ResearchStudy.
Mapping is based on presumption that research subject will be tied to site-specific ResearchStudy, which will then be part of overall ResearchStudy.

span.title:
Sponsor's subject Identifier for the study
Sponsor's subject Identifier for the study
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td:
Study subject is found by finding the StudySubject that corresponds to the same Patient and ResearchStudy as the Observation.
Study subject is found by finding the StudySubject that corresponds to the same Patient and ResearchStudy as the Observation.

span.title: The name of the clinical encounter. This can included planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures and assessments that may be performed on a subject
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: Encounter should have a standard instantiatesCanonical extension that would allow pointing to the ActivityDefinition. This would be the ActivityDefinition.name. Submit a change request to add the extension

span.title: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started)
The field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTM components

Vital Signs Performed
Vital Signs Performed
This field is not an SDTM variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable VSSTAT. If VSPERF="N", the value of VSSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If VSPErF="Y", VSSTAT should be NULL

Vital Signs Date
Vital Signs Date
This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

Vital Signs Time
Vital Signs Time
This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

Category for Vital Signs
Category for Vital Signs
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

Subcategory for Vital Signs
Subcategory for Vital Signs
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td:
FHIR allows multiple categorizations at various levels of granularity.
FHIR allows multiple categorizations at various levels of granularity.

span.title:
Vital Signs Group ID
Vital Signs Group ID
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: This would typically be done by having the related Observations being 'membersOf' a common parent Observation.

tr.th: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name

span.title:
Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name
Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: TimePoints will be represented in FHIR as PlanDefinition.activities.

span.title:
Vital Signs Completion Status
Vital Signs Completion Status
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: In some instances, VSSTAT="NOT DONE" records will come from FHIR Observation resources where Observation.status="cancelled".

tr.th: Vital Signs Results or Finding in Original Units

span.title:
VS Result or Finding in Original Units
VS Result or Finding in Original Units
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: Ensure the value provided from the EHR is considered an actual value (result), an interpretation or range.

span.title:
VS Original Units
VS Original Units
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

Vital Signs Clinical Significance
Vital Signs Clinical Significance

Vital Signs Position of Subject
Vital Signs Position of Subject
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: This is often pre-coordinated into the Observation.code, but can also be expressed in the method

span.title:
Location of Vital Signs Measurement
Location of Vital Signs Measurement
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: Requires knowledge or review of data to ensure location, laterality and directionality are included in the code and can be parsed.

span.title:
Vital Signs Laterality
Vital Signs Laterality
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: Requires knowledge or review of data to ensure location, laterality and directionality are included in the code and can be parsed.

span.title:
Vital Signs Directionality
Vital Signs Directionality
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s).

tr.td: Requires knowledge or review of data to ensure location, laterality and directionality are included in the code and can be parsed.

span.title:
Vital Signs Test Name
Vital Signs Test Name

The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). The SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in VSTESTCD and VSTEST. Both VSTESTCD and VSTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

Vital Signs Sponsor-Defined Identifier
Vital Signs Sponsor-Defined Identifier
The corresponding CDASH Variable(s) map directly to identified SDTM Variable(s). May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

tr.td: The assigner of the identifier can be explicit or inferred by the Identifier.system.

span.title:
Vital Signs Repetition Number
Vital Signs Repetition Number

The repetition number of test/measurement within the time point ma be preprinted on the CRF (e.g.. multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).
The repetition number of test/measurement within the time point ma be preprinted on the CRF (e.g.. multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).

tr.td: This could be captured as a specific ActivityDefinition where you'd have a distinct ActivityDefinition for each occurrence. However, it is more likely to be a single ActivityDefinition for the test and an extension would be added on Observation.instantiates to indicate which occurrence is the Observation.
